title: Don’t trust an old school British Hi-Fi Company...
text: With your streaming app that is. The LS50 speakers are great, yet are handicapped by an app that is as unusable as it is unstable. Think multiple restarts of the app and speakers due to connectivity drops despite that my Google Wifi point is less than a foot away from the master speaker. The app has not been updated in almost a year, despite the 1.8 star rating here, proof that KEF either doesn’t care or has given up. I don’t which is worse, honestly. On top of all this, the Tidal integration is a minimalist horrid interpretation of the original version. Likely selling these speakers and moving to a Sonos.

title: Works okay with iTunes
text:
First the dumb: you must find and turn off speakers from Control app. Then go back to Steaming app, which will find your iTunes library, and then you can stream over WiFi (once your speakers are setup on your network, which isn’t difficult.) 

Now the okay: Latest app ver. will let you adjust volume in app using side buttons on iPhone (so you don’t have to switch back to control app), however when you are not in app, volume up/down don’t work. You can create playlist in the app, and it will also populate playlists from your iTunes library. You don’t have to use tidal to steam if your iTunes library is good enough.

Finally the good: speakers are outstanding, with good looks, soundstage, base response, and crisp detail at high volume, even over WiFi. 

KEF apps are taking hard knocks (maybe deservedly do). I am posting a review for iPhone/iTunes users to allow that app experience with KEF is okay. Speakers are worth the minor annoyances of WiFi streaming.

You can always connect your laptop or iPad to USB port. The included KEF remote will allow  play, advance, back, and volume control.

title: Unreliable connection, closed ecosystem
text:
The sound of the speakers is great, if one can connect a source to them. Initially I thought the WiFI was the issue, but I connected the speaker to my hard wired network. Speakers are pingable all day long. It's the app which seems to be unreliable. It fails to reconnect / find the speakers, even though the IP address is fixed. Anyways, how hard is it to cache the IP address and try that first? 

 The app is required to stream music to the speakers over the local network. To utilize the higher bit rate sources, you have to use WiFi/ Ethernet interface. Bluetooth streaming seems to work well enough and it's compatible with iTunes (Note: only over Bluetooth). I'm guessing there is some sort of DRM restrictions that prevent that. 

In any case they have integrated with Tidal Music service which provides high data rate encoded music, but at this point, I'm hesitant to sign up for a $16/ month subscription until I can connect reliably. I'm sure I'm not the only one with some buyers remorse and mixed feelings over this experience. 

The most reliable connection is direct USB from a computer with a streaming source. So, wait for several speaker firmware and app versions, and maybe they will figure out how to fix the connectivity problems.

- Me, after no answer for 3 months: Hi kef, my ls50w cannot play AAC file. Can you help?

title: Great speakers (LS50W) torpedoed by a crap app
text:
The LS50W are without a doubt an amazing all in one streamer/dac/amp/speaker combinatation. Sound quality, dynamics, detail and image are really impressive for a speaker of this size and at this price point.

But...we’re not here to review the speaker are we. The KEF Stream app is absolutely the Achilles heal of this total package. As much as I love the idea of this being a plug and play system to stream Spotify or Tidal without any additional hardware..it’s just not a viable reality given the poor reliability/stability of the KEF Stream app. It constantly drops the speaker connection while other devices on my network continue to operate flawlessly. 

My sense is (as others have opined) that KEF, as one of the legends of British loudspeaker design and engineering, just don’t have the depth of resources and engineering talent to execute at the level needed to be a top tier player in the digital domain. I truly hope they can make the shift and elevate their capability in this regard as I’m confident they can deliver best in class digital audio technologies and loudspeakers if they can get this right. As it stands today, that is not the case. 
 
For that reason, 1 star for the app holding back a pair of 5 star speakers. My solution has been to until Roon and simply utilize the speakers as a Roon endpoint.

title: KEF + Tidal = Change to Spotify
text: I was a Tidal user and desperately wanted to continue using it with the wonderful KEF speakers, but it simply is not functional — keeps dropping out, always skips tracks, etc. I’d like to think that I can hear the difference between Tidal and Spotify, although haven’t properly tested myself, but the one thing I’m sure of is the difference between music playing and music not playing. Unfortunately, KEF + Tidal = music not playing.  Hence what I presume was meant to be a great partnership between Tidal and KEF has resulted in a bunch of others and I jumping ship and switching to Spotify. This probably doesn’t impact KEF so much, but if I were an executive at Tidal, I’d make darn sure it was fixed quickly, or I’d drop the partnership. It can’t be good for business. Sure ain’t good for listening to music.

title: Works for me
text: I’ve seen all the problems people are noting with this app.  For my purposes, it seems fully functional.  For example, it immediately recognized both of the music servers on my pc and I was able to stream all compatible file formats, up to my 24/192 high res files without significant lag or skipping over my WiFi lan.  I haven’t tried it with Tidal, since I switched to another 16/44 service a couple years ago due to content concerns.  The app could certainly use some refinement and lags far behind my multi-room Sonos system in terms of features and intuitiveness, but it does the job.  I do, however, miss gapless playback.  In summary, it allows this system to do what it does best.....sound amazing!
